page.title: 17Picking and Packaging.
page.content: Our area grows large amounts of fruit and vegetables which have to be picked and packaged.Perrett's do a lot of packaging.They pack cabbages,salad stuff,onions,cucumbers,calabrese, sprouts,peppers etc. They handle between a hundred and a hundred and twenty tonnes per day.They employ one hundred and eighty people on a permanent basis,but in the summer this could rise to four hundred.The women wash,pack and prepare the goods whilst the men load,drive and sell the vegetables.The vegetables travel to supermarkets such as Tesco's, Sainsbury's and Littlewood's. Approximately ten lorries leave laden each day.Perrett's also have their own land on which they grow vegetables,and two farms and nurseries which are run by their own staff.They are important employers in this area.
